article.title: Theoretical Systematics of Future Baryon Acoustic Oscillation Surveys

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the left panels of Figure 1 show?
choices: The cross-correlation coefficient between wiggled FastPM and MP-Gadget simulations.
The difference in halo bias between wiggled FastPM and MP-Gadget simulations.
The transfer function between wiggled FastPM and MP-Gadget simulations.
The variance in matter power spectra between wiggled FastPM and MP-Gadget simulations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main implication of the negligible residual for the matter field (blue squares) in the third row of Figure 2?
choices: MP-Gadget simulations are more accurate than FastPM simulations.
FastPM and MP-Gadget simulations agree well in modeling the BAO feature.
Density field reconstruction is equally effective in both FastPM and MP-Gadget simulations.
Stochastic effects during structure growth are insignificant in FastPM simulations.

multiple_choice_question.text: By what factor does the sample-variance cancellation technique improve the signal-to-noise ratio near k∼0.05h Mpc−1 for matter at z=0.6?
What is the main reason for the better performance of the BAO fitting models in Figure 4 compared to previous studies?
choices: Inclusion of a wider k-range in the fitting.
Increased number of realizations in the analysis.
Removal of additive nonlinear effects due to differencing wiggled and dewiggled simulations.
Higher resolution of the FastPM simulations used.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the value q represent in Equation 19?
choices: The wavenumber of the BAO peak.
The linear bias of the galaxies.
The smoothing scale of the density field.
